project.teaser: IndiBrain is a doctorate network designed to provide training in computational neuroscience research, leading to doctoral degrees for 15 doctoral candidates (DCs). The project aims to transform new and existing partnerships of 12 universities into enduring collaborations...
project.objective:
IndiBrain is a doctorate network designed to provide training in computational neuroscience research, leading to doctoral degrees for 15 doctoral candidates (DCs). The project aims to transform new and existing partnerships of 12 universities into enduring collaborations. Along with contributions from 11 industrial and training partners, our consortium creates the foundation for an European network of highly skilled, resilient, entrepreneurial, and creative neuroscientists. To ensure an innovative training environment for its DCs, the consortium bundles unique European expertise in neuroscience, cutting-edge neuroimaging, along with neurotechnology and computational modeling.
Building on experience gained in earlier DNs, IndiBrain’s scientific goal is to advance understanding of individual differences in neuroplasticity and brain dynamics in health and disease using technologies like ultra-high-resolution MRI. The DCs will develop and apply innovative tools for studying the brain, focussing on individual-level biological interpretability, and using vision as a model system. Our training network is a critical step in advancing our understanding of the brain with translation applications in mind for improving diagnosis, treatment, and rehabilitation, ultimately resulting in a better quality of life for individuals with ocular and neurological conditions, as well as healthcare effectiveness and sustainability in the EU and beyond.
The network will equip DCs with transferable skills in science communication, collaboration, business development, grant writing, and responsible AI use, improving their career opportunities in research, industry, and as entrepreneurs. They will inspire each other to excel in fundamental and translational research, both during and long after the funding period. Anticipating continued demand for the expertise of our DCs, we envision IndiBrain as a model for future-oriented European doctoral training in computational neuroscience.
project.title: Characterizing Individual Differences in Brain Plasticity and Dynamics to help ensure Effective and Sustainable Health Care
project.keywords: Human visual cortex, neuroplasticity, neuro-imaging data analysis, functional magnetic resonance imaging, fMRI, rehabilitation, ophthalmology, neurology

article.title: Training in neuroscience for ocular and neurological conditions

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
